newsitem.title: ITALY: Minister confirms Italy '98 budget of 25 trln lire.
newsitem.headline: Minister confirms Italy '98 budget of 25 trln lire.

text.p: Foreign Trade Minister Augusto Fantozzi confirmed on Friday that Italy's 1998 budget would be for an amount not exceeding 25 trillion lire.

Fantozzi was asked by reporters while attending a CISL trades union congress if 25 trillion lire of deficit-trimming measures would be enough to reach the government's goal of a deficit/GDP ratio of below 3.0 percent next year.
"It will certainly be enough," Fantozzi said, adding "public finances are relatively under control," and that "the recovery is there even if we are only seeing the first signs of it."
Last Friday, Budget undersecretary Giorgio Macciotta told Reuters the deficit/GDP ratio was heading for 4.0 percent in 1998 and this needed to narrow by 1.2 percent, or 25 trillion lire.
Prime Minister Romano Prodi said on Thursday that Italy's deficit/GDP ratio was already at the 3.0 percent level required to join the single European currency from its planned January 1999 start.
